rComments: The best professor i have ever had. He is very understanding and is so nice. A real Gem

Great prof. C-level classes with him are discussion heavy. He really cares about his students, pop quizzes are easy as long as you've done your readings, and the assignments help you prepare for final essay. But as with all geography courses, get ready to read a lot.

A great prof who cares about his lectures as much as he cares about his research work. Very clear and thought provoking lectures, no heavy accent, no nonsense. Research papers are a pain, tests not so, but if you put the effort you'll be guaranteed to do well. No textbook needed!

He may be the best professor at UTSC. He is the exact opposite of the typical uni prof. He cares, answers his students' questions properly engages everyone, he gives all the information that he can towards exams/assignments, he genuinely wants all his students to succeed. Not to mention, his TA's are fantastic too. 10/10

One of the best, if not the best professor at UTSC. Lectures are content heavy but he does his absolute best to make it interesting. When you ask questions (depending on exams or assignment) he will do everything in his power to help you have a higher grade. His TA's are awesome as well. Highly recommend taking his classes
Prof Ekers made this course very enjoyable. Sometimes the material could be a bit dry but he did his best to keep us interested. Very passionate and also a great guy
a really nice guy and a good lecturer
He's a wonderful professor and very informative. He is enthusiastic about the field and shows his interest by bringing good topics of research for the class. I really enjoyed his class!
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Ekers made this class so interesting. He cares about the subject and makes you care about it too. I hope I am able to take another course with him while at UTSC!

Professor Ekers was really nice and kind towards all the students, he even gives out extra marks! The course is really interesting if you actually stay on top of your work. Prof was great and I'd take his classes again for sure.
Super great, informative lectures and a really fair exam. He made everything he covered super interesting, even the things I didn't necessarily care about beforehand. His exams were also very fair.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: First lecture I ever attended in uni, glad he was the prof. Plus, he once played Arcade Fire.

Great prof knows his stuff. Lectures sometimes very heavy and packed with material so its hard to keep up. You can tell he cares a lot about his work and his students. Overall class wasn't too difficult - just try to keep up with the readings, do your assignments way ahead of the deadline and make sure to review the lecture material before exams.
Hands down best professor I've had at UTSC. Definitely looking forward to taking another one of his classes!!

Professor Ekers is a fantastic Prof. It doesn't matter if you're not in Geography, everyone should take his course. He's kind, understanding and fair. His courses bring up current issues. He's excited about his work which make it easy to pay attention. He's very personable and the content is interesting and engaging. great prof! A student favourite

Prof Ekers is an excellent educator that is truly passionate and interested in everything he teaches. The lectures are both thought provoking and entertaining.  The readings he assigns are important for both the Midterm and Final. The T.A.s are fair markers and great lecturers. It's a great class and easy way to obtain any credit or prerequisite.

Prof. Ekers is an extremely kind man and very funny. He's 100% there for his students and tries to use controversial topics to get the class involved and learning. He's not demanding work wise, but his assignments call you to explore your own position in light of global issues. If there is one thing to do at utsc, it's taking one of his classes

By far this was my favourite first year course. Professor Ekers is super organized, clear, and really nice. It's evident that he really cares about his students. The lectures and readings were interesting and thought provoking. He gives ample opportunity to excel in the course with multiple assignments and the exams were quite easy.

Let me start off by saying I have not gone a year without taking one of Ekers' courses, and I am an economics major- I am not the only one who does this.  He is a crowd favourite and for good reason too. While he is not an 'easy' professor, he is a fair professor and if you choose to put in effort, you will like the outcome. Best prof at UTSC!
great professor.

He is very considerate and is clear with what he wants and is not as demanding. I have always looked forward to his lectures because he is really organized and it is easy for me to annotate and follow his powerpoint presentations. He always makes sure he goes through the material thoroughly before moving on to the next. Favourite professor so far!

Hes lectures were boring and lenthy, but the powerpoints pretty much summed up the course material including the readings. Never did any readings and ended up doing well Plus his exams were mostly based off his powerpoints... easy guy worth taking his classes
